H0.text: Colony is the type of social structure that ants, termites, bees, and wasps live in, which may include millions of individual insects.

H1.text: Family is the type of social structure that may include millions of individual insects in which ants, termites, bees, and wasps live.

H2.text: Habitat is the type of social structure in which ants, termites, bees, and wasps live, and it may include millions of individual insects.

H3.text: Community is the type of social structure in which ants, termites, bees, and wasps live, potentially including millions of individual insects.

A4.text: Eusocial insects such as ants and bees are multicellular animals that live in colonies with a highly organized social structure.

A5.text: Colonies of some social insects may be deemed superorganisms.
